Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 191 of 197 2732 LCHCmax7

1 the government charged the case, Jane had discussed with
2 Glassman whether to cooperate with the case, and during those
3 conversations, Glassman had advised Jane to cooperate, and
4 discussed with Jane that cooperating with the case was the
5 morally right thing to do, and they had discussed how
6 testifying at trial was the right thing to do. Glassman also
7 mentioned that Glassman had told Jane it would, quote, help her
8 case, unquote.
9
10 It is further stipulated and agreed that this
11 stipulation, marked as Defense Exhibit A6, may be received in
12 evidence at trial. And it's dated with today's date, signed by
13 the parties.
14 MS. COMEY: No objection.
15 THE COURT: A6 is admitted.
16 (Defendant's Exhibit A6 received in evidence)
17 MR. EVERDELL: May I have a moment, your Honor?
18 THE COURT: You may.
19 MR. EVERDELL: Your Honor, those are all the
20 stipulations.
21 THE COURT: Go ahead, Ms. Sternheim.
22 MS. STERNHEIM: Thank you, Judge. At this time, the
23 defense rests.
24 THE COURT: Ms. Comey.
25 MS. COMEY: The government has no further case, your
26 Honor.

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00014297

text_blocks.content: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 191 of 197 2732 LCHCmax7

the government charged the case, Jane had discussed with Glassman whether to cooperate with the case, and during those conversations, Glassman had advised Jane to cooperate, and discussed with Jane that cooperating with the case was the morally right thing to do, and they had discussed how testifying at trial was the right thing to do. Glassman also mentioned that Glassman had told Jane it would, quote, help her case, unquote.
It is further stipulated and agreed that this stipulation, marked as Defense Exhibit A6, may be received in evidence at trial. And it's dated with today's date, signed by the parties.
MR. EVERDELL: May I have a moment, your Honor?
MR. EVERDELL: Your Honor, those are all the stipulations.
THE COURT: Go ahead, Ms. Sternheim.
MS. STERNHEIM: Thank you, Judge. At this time, the defense rests.
MS. COMEY: The government has no further case, your Honor.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a clear and legible format. There are no visible redactions or damage to the document.
